thread.title: Piers Morgan says Scarlett Moffatt's success has "effectively ended" her parents' TV career after Gogglebox axe
thread.title_full: Piers Morgan says Scarlett Moffatt's success has "effectively ended" her parents' TV career after Gogglebox axe

author: Nicola Agius
title: Piers Morgan says Scarlett Moffatt's success has "effectively ended" her parents' TV career after Gogglebox axe
text:
Piers Morgan says Scarlett Moffatt's success has "effectively ended" her parents' TV career after Gogglebox axe The Moffatt family will not be featured on Gogglebox after Scarlett chose to leave last year Share Piers Morgan talks about Moffatt family (Photo: ITV) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Piers Morgan has suggested Scarlett Moffatt ’s growing success has “effectively ended” her parents’ television career following their Gogglebox axe. 
The 26-year-old found fame alongside dad Mark and mum Betty in the Channel 4 fly-on-the-wall show, before leaving the show and being propelled to stardom when she won I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! in December. 
Then it was reported this week that Gogglebox has decided to drop the Moffatt family from the new series, following Scarlett's departure. Piers was a bit sarcastic about the Moffatts today (Photo: Rex Features) Scarlett says she's "gutted" by her parents' TV axe (Photo: Rex Features) Read More 'I'm gutted': Shocked Scarlett Moffatt speaks out as Channel 4 bosses axe her family from Gogglebox 
Talking about the story on Good Morning Britain today, co-host Piers commented: “It will be a bit tense in the Moffatt household. Young Scarlett becomes a big star through I’m A Celebrity and has now effectively ended her parents’ TV career.” 
Entertainment editor Richard Arnold then joked: “I heard she’s bought a mock Tudor mansion in Berks, a sit down mower and her parents are actually sleeping in a car outside, it’s that awkward. 
"I’m just kidding kids - and lawyers!” Piers didn't seem too fussed by the Gogglebox news (Photo: ITV) 
Piers then got all sarcastic, saying he was “gutted” the Moffatts had left Gogglebox. 
“I’m distraught by the Moffatts not being on Gogglebox as somebody who has never watched Gogglebox or even heard of [the family] - I couldn’t be less devastated.” 
Last night, Scarlett admitted she didn't expect producers to take such extreme measures. 
Taking to Twitter, the jungle queen posted a picture of herself with her parents at the National Television Awards. Betty Moffatt, MarkMoffatt, Scarlett Moffatt (Photo: Splash News) Bosses decided to leave mum Betty, dad Mark and sister Ava-Grace out of the next series following her success on I’m A Celebrity (Photo: ITV) Read More 
She captioned the image: "We are going to miss doing #gogglebox so so much but can’t wait to watch the new series (good luck my fellow goggleboxers you will smash it love the Moffatts)." 
The reality beauty then admitted she was "gutted" her family had been dropped from the show. 
Replying to a fan on Twitter, she wrote: "We are gutted too, thought my Mam and dad (and little Ava) would still be able to do it but we will still be watching #gogglebox." 
Betty, Mark and Ava-Grace have been regulars on the hit Channel 4 show, critiquing shows from their sofa in Bishop Auckland, Co Durham. Scarlett wasn't expecting Channel 4 bosses to do THAT (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
